column5: A couple months ago my girlfriend lost her first "child" and best friend...  Rusty was a 13 year old Chocolate Lab, and the hard decision was made to have him put down...  With that in mind her birthday was coming up and I was at a loss as to what to do for her...  Then it came to me....  So I contacted a few family members and got the ball rolling....  Here is what we did....  I hope you like it as much as she does...            These pictures do not do the painting any justice... but give you the general idea..  I am thinking of framing it in barnboard to go with the country setting of our property..  I would like to thank the artist that painted this for me on VERY short notice. Without him I would not have seen this..     I will leave the artist anonymous.. unless he wants to come forward and present himself.. A huge thank you for helping me pull this off!!!  G.
hey that is a very nice thing to do man!!!!  Cheers!
That's awesome Gerritt.....what a nice memory for your GF
The look on her face says it all.
That is great Gerritt and for sure the look on her face sais it all I bet the barn board will set the picture off very nice.
Atta boy! I had a Golden Retreiver named "Rusty" too!
Very nice,  Both the painting and the thought.
Wow Gerritt, that's so sweet.  Good for you for thinking of something so sentimental like that.  I can see in the pic she is very moved.  Way to go.  Joey
Wow!...what a great way to gain brownie points...  You're just an old smoothie Gerritt...  What a thoughtful thing to do...
First off G,very nice gift.  As for the artist,nice work.  Im going to throw out a guess here,,,,,,,,,,,,,Bushart?

Hey Gerritt,  Glad we were able to pull it off within that timeframe,  Definetely is a thoughtful thing to do.  darn that Misfish guy though---you know them hunters--always lookin for clues,  I kept one of the last pics--may give a little clearer view---that canvas was kinda big and all that green really gives a glare in the pic taking.  All The Best.  Me
I noticed the work right off the bat. Very nice job friend.
Right on Gerritt!!! I'm sure your GF will cherish this beautiful work of art for ever Leechman
Very nice G!  A picture does say a thousands words now doesn't it.
Very thoughtful Gerritt, good on ya!
Awesome, good on ya both. Great to see stuff like this.
Excellent G and so is the painting!
At first I thought you got her a new dog, but this is a far better gift.  Good going G!
